intro: Gnaphalium caroense, commonly known as the Caro's feather grass, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. Its silver-gray foliage and feathery inflorescences make it an attractive species for xerophytic gardens. It is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and withstand drought.
